text: hi folks i'm bob strachan i'm a
principal solutions architect here at
aws and today i'm going to show you a
demo of amazon transcribe specifically a
feature called custom vocabulary
amazon transcribe is an automatic speech
recognition service that can be used
when you have audio and video that
contains speech that you want to convert
to text it supports over 30 languages it
supports batch where you transcribe
pre-recorded files
or real time where the audio stream is
transcribed as it's being produced
if your speech has domain specific terms
like proper names brand names or
technical jargon then you'll want to use
the custom vocabulary feature
this feature can help you enhance
transcription accuracy by addressing
these custom terms using a list of
specific words or phrases that you want
transcribed to recognize in the demo
i'll customize transcribe to recognize
skateboarding trick names that i saw
during the tokyo olympics by creating
two types of custom vocabulary
supporting both custom pronunciation and
custom display
so let's dive straight into the demo
so i've logged into my aws account and
i've opened up amazon transcribe in my
browser i selected the real-time
transcription tool here from the menu on
the top left and we'll do some live
streaming and to see how well the
transcription works
i've enjoyed some of the new olympic
sports this year especially
skateboarding
the tricks performed by the
skateboarders have some interesting
names there's the ollie where the skater
somehow manages to leap into the air on
their skateboard and land again without
their feet ever leaving the board
variations on the olleh include the
front side 180 olli or the front side
360 olli and there's also the nollie
where the jump starts from the nose of
the board
so taking a look at the transcription
output it looks like transcribe did
pretty well um first sentence looks
right
in fact it looks like most of this is
correct even with my um accent except
for the names of the skateboard tricks
it's got all the a wrong there that
should be o l o-l-l-i-e
and the same thing with the variations
on the olli
these are examples of domain-specific
vocabulary these are words that
transcribe is not familiar with so we're
going to teach transcribe how to
accurately recognize these words using
custom vocabulary
transcribe gives us two ways to define
custom vocabularies we can use a list or
we can use a table it's a little bit
easier to use a list so we'll start by
using that approach
so here i've created a text file on my
computer with a list of the
skateboarding tricks i want to teach
transcribe to recognize
i separate the words in the phrases
using a dash and we spell out the
numbers the transcribed documentation
explains how to create these list format
files
so i'm going to save that as a file in
my computer and we'll create a custom
vocabulary in the transcribe console
so select custom vocabulary on the left
create vocabulary
and give it a name
we'll stick with english us we're going
to do file upload for the list format so
we'll choose our file
cv list click open and click create
vocabulary
it takes a couple of minutes to create
so pause the video and come back when
it's done
all right our custom vocabulary is now
ready so let's go back to real-time
transcription
we'll go down to additional settings
we'll enable custom vocabulary
and we'll select our custom vocabulary
now we're ready to start
streaming i've enjoyed some of the new
olympic sports this year especially
skateboarding
the skateboarding tricks have some
interesting names
there's the ollie where the skateboarder
somehow manages to leap into the air on
their skateboard and land again without
their feet ever leaving the board
variations on the ollie include the
front side 180 olly or the front side
360 ollie
and there's also the nollie where the
jump starts from the nose of the board
other tricks include the salad grind the
stale fish and the cabbage aerial named
after its inventor
they're all fascinating to watch
so let's take a look at our
transcription output to see how we did
with our custom vocabulary transcribe
now recognizes the olli
the variation's only all a big
improvement over our previous
transcription although i think with our
next iteration we'll use the table
format custom vocabulary to further
refine the output that we see in the
transcription for these trick names and
we'll also teach it how to recognize the
additional trick names i added in the
final paragraph
so let's take a look at the tax valve
we're building here for the table format
the first row is a header row that tells
us what each column is first column is
the phrase
the second column is ipa which stands
for international phonetic alphabet this
is an optional field that allows you to
map sounds
to the transcription output that you
want
or you can use the sounds like column if
you use one you can't use the other but
the sounds like allows you to simply
spell out what the incoming sound is
like and then the final column is the
display as this is the word or the
phrase that you want to appear in your
transcription
so let's go ahead and create a custom
vocabulary using the table format that
we have here
so the file we just created needs to be
in an s3 bucket so that we can create a
cable format custom vocabulary so i've
done that here i created a bucket i
uploaded my file
we'll just copy the s3 location
go back to transcribe custom vocabulary
create vocabulary this time we'll call
it cv table
we'll do the s3 location for the table
format and we'll paste in the location
to our table from the s3 bucket
create vocabulary and again it takes a
couple of minutes so we'll come back
when it's ready
and now it's ready so we'll go back to
transcription
we'll set it to use our new custom
vocabulary
cv table
variations on the ole include the front
side 180 olli or the front side 360 olli
and there's also the nollie where the
jump starts from the nose of the board
other tricks include the solid grind the
steel fish and the cabbie uriel named
after its inventor they are all
fascinating to watch
so using custom vocabulary we've just
taught transcribe how to understand skip
boarding vernacular and of course you
can use the same technique
to teach any domain specific set of
terminologies
and of course you can use custom
vocabularies with batch transcription
jobs as well as real-time transcription
here's one that i had set up earlier i
had pre-recorded
my audio as an mp3 file
i specified i wanted to use the same
custom vocabulary that we just used for
a real-time transcription the cv table
and you can see that it understands the
skip boarding vernacular here in the
transcription output
and that's it folks i hope you found
this useful you can check out the blog
here for more information
and i'll see you next time
